chargeHist.descr: Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) (939.05 Party to a Crime)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell J Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Russell J Thompson
parties.address: 3347 S Sunnyslope Rd #208, New Berlin, WI 53151

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
With release to the Community Justice Resource Center (CJRC) ONLY. Court would allow good time.
While serving his sentence at the CJRC, the Court ordered the following:
No alcohol or controlled substances.
AODA assessment and treatment.
Urine screens to ensure compliance.
Be given parenting classes/counseling and job and vocational training.
Seek and maintain employment.

Court ordered defendant to pay the DNA surcharge, plus costs, disbursements and surcharges, to be paid within one (1) year of today's date (6/3/15).  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant, which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell J Thompson

defendant.name: Thompson, Russell J

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Russell J Thompson in court with attorney Susan M Roth.  Defendant Russell J Thompson in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

/submitted by the State, received and filed.  Defendant now charged with the following:
Misdemeanor Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<$500), a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wis. Stats. sections 943.50(1m)(b) and (4)(a) and 939.05.

Attorney Susan M Roth in court, defendant Russell J Thompson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Russell J Thompson in court with attorney Susan M Roth.  Defendant Russell J Thompson in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Absolutely no release from home (24 Hour Curfew), GPS monitoring. Defendant is  to be monitored by drug testing. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's Department Store. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Russell J Thompson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Russell J Thompson in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
